clay

Class Clay

  • java.lang.Object
    • clay.Clay

  • public class Clay
extends Object
    The class responsible for the mapping of CSV records to Java classes. To create a list of Users from the CSV input: 
     
 name,age
 John,42
 Sara,28
    where the Java class simply looks like this: 
     
 public class User {
     String name;
     int age;
 }
    do the following: 
     
 Clay clay = new Clay(new StringInput("name,age\n" +
                                      "John,42\n" +
                                      "Sara,28"));

 for (User user : clay.as(User.class)) {
   System.out.println(user.name + " " + user.age);
 }

 // John 42
 // Sara 28

    • Constructor Detail

      • Clay

        public Clay(CSVInput input)
     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new Clay instance where the first record of the input will be considered the header.
        Parameters:
        input - the input from which to get the records.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the input contains less than 2 records, or the header (the first record) is empty.

      • Clay

        public Clay(CSVInput input,
            String... headers)
        Creates a new Clay instance from the given input and headers.
        Parameters:
        input - the input from which to get the records.
        headers - the headers that map the header names to instance variables of Java classes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the input contains no records, or the header is empty.

      • Clay

        public Clay(CSVInput input,
            List<String> headers)
        Creates a new Clay instance from the given input and headers.
        Parameters:
        input - the input from which to get the records.
        headers - the headers that map the header names to instance variables of Java classes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when the input contains no records, or the header is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • as

        public <T> List<T> as(Class<T> type)
               throws com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException
        Returns a list of values of a specific type from all records of the input.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the Java class the input should be converted to.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to convert each record from the input to.
        Returns:
        a list of values of a specific type from all records of the input.
        Throws:
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - when one of the records could not be converted to the provided type.
